page.title: 07Marshlands of Silverdale
page.content: About five sixths of this part of Morecambe Bay is covered by sea at some time of the year.About half is covered by neap tides, the rest by spring tides.This latter is covered with good quality turf which is cut and sold to gardeners. Sheep graze at low tides keeping the grass short. The marshlands continually change. Each high tide, especially when backed with a strong wind, causes more grass to be lost. The drainage channel from Leighton Moss has been improved recently to help lessen the effect of the erosion, but unfortunately the grassland is disappearing very rapidly. Although many areas of quicksand are to be found, the Cross Bay Walk sometimes passes through the area as did the old Morecambe - Grange route.
